definition: to be crippled (in an accident etc)
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey
(bound form) fine/delicate

sentences.english: Millions more are injured or disabled.
sentences.chinese: 还有数百万人受伤或致残。

sentences.english: Those wounded or disabled on the job are provided living expenses from the state or the collective.
sentences.chinese: 对于因公致伤致残的，其生活费用由国家和集体承担。

sentences.english: Mostly, he sits in a wheelchair, crippled by brittle bone disease.
sentences.chinese: 由于脆骨病致残，他大多数情况下坐在轮椅上。

sentences.english: Help an amputee with the War Amps.
sentences.chinese: 茱莉亚说，“帮助那些因战争致残的人。

sentences.english: The disease left her with a crippling jumble of nerves jutting out from the base of her spine.
sentences.chinese: 疾病造成从她的脊椎底神经致残漏外。

sentences.english: Hundreds are alleged to have been killed or maimed.
sentences.chinese: 还有上百人据称已被杀害或致残。

sentences.english: Because labour causes damage retired worker whether allowance of plan hair difficulty?
sentences.chinese: 因工致残退休职工是否计发困难补贴？

sentences.english: Problem of Employees Early Retirement and the Solution;
sentences.chinese: 因工致残退休职工是否计发困难补贴？

sentences.english: He also attempted and failed to change the Persian religion by maiming the divine prophet Zarathustra.
sentences.chinese: 他还试图改变而无法波斯宗教的神圣先知如是致残。

sentences.english: It has high incidence of rupturing, often causes disability or even death.
sentences.chinese: 动脉瘤破裂出血的发病率高，常使患者致残或死亡。

sentences.english: Objective To detect early clinical symptoms of trauma-induced tardive intracranial hematoma for the purse of lowering the mortality and mutilation rate.
sentences.chinese: 目的早期发现迟发性颅内血肿，降低死亡率和致残率。

sentences.english: The X-ray findings were osteolysis of the phalanges and mutilating arthropathy of the lower limb.
sentences.chinese: 足部X线检查发现趾骨骨质吸收和致残性关节病。

sentences.english: Stroke is a major cause of death and disability.
sentences.chinese: 脑卒中是一种高死亡率与高致残率的疾病。

sentences.english: It is in the lack of safety and lack of love that your species harms and maims ;
sentences.chinese: 在缺乏安全和爱中，你们的物种做出伤害并致残。
